Later, for the convenience of writing, " Yu " was omitted to represent the entire instrument, and then the wind instrument was extended to express the comfort of breath.

The second theory is that " in " is " called on " the beginning of the text, like the tubular instrument in the form of breath, the original meaning is called on gas. There is also a third theory. Sun Yongchang believes that the "Yu" in the yun is like the lines and textures of the bamboo tube on the surface.

The first kind of " in " originally referred to the " yu " statement by Guo, Lee Hyo be, Qiu Xigui and other masters. The example of the oracle bone inscription refers to the musical instrument "ç«½". It is also used as a preposition to introduce time, place, and people.

As for the second version of the original article using " Yu " as " Yue ", it can be traced back to Xu Shen, and it was put forward by Guan Ziyin in recent years. Charles " in " word written on, "said the text" in the " loss ", which is interpreted as: "a loss, to be like qi Shu loss from Kao from a, one of its gas level also.." Check " to " The structure of the characters is actually the same as the characters " hu ", " xi ", " hao " and so on , and they are all related to our various breathing and aspiration activities. " In " is likely to be " called on " the beginning of the text, its original meaning should be to "sigh" meaning " Calls ." The word " Yu " in the inscriptions of the Western Zhou Dynasty was used as a verb, meaning to go and go, such as Xian Gui: "Xian Bo Yu King", Ling Gui: "Yu Wang Yu defeated Chu Bo, in Yan." Same usage as in The Book of Songs , Such as "Zhou Nan. "Caiping": "in the stream". It can also be interpreted as surpassing and transcending. For example, in "Xunzi Encouraging Learning", there is "ice, water for it, and coldness for water", which is extremely abstract. About " in the ancient text font" word. In addition to the simpler way of writing "Conggengongyi", the inscriptions on bronze and oracle bones also preserved another more complicated way of writing. Regarding the peculiar way of writing the character " Yu " in the oracle bone inscriptions, especially the set of lines that seem to overlap on the right side, Xu Zhongshu believes that " Yu " originally means "big compass." We think this statement is not convincing. Judging from the more complicated glyphs of the oracle bones and bronze inscriptions, we think that " Yu " is probably the province written by the two-stage omission of " Yu " as a wind instrument. In other words, the shape and structure of the word Yu can also be Congsheng. Ancient writing " yu " is actually like a tubular objects, due to the " yu " is used to playing, Oracle in means "yu tube yu middle" word there " to " being expressed blowing in it. And the more complicated " Yu " in the so-called "from the ç«½ province" is actually to save the right wall of the ç«½ tube and the breath in the ç«½ tube (that is, the original character of "äº"). So " yu presence" of the word, classical and " yu " in the there " to ", can be said to be " in the original meaning" as it called on the gas, " called on " the extremely strong side of the card.

According to the two arguments, the first argument is the mainstream opinion of the paleographer community, but this website believes that the second argument also has sufficient cognitive justifications.
